data.title: Jesse Metcalfe
data.meta_description:
Jesse Metcalfe. Actor: Desperate Housewives. Award-winning actor and producer Jesse Metcalfe was born in Northern California's Carmel Valley.

Raised in Waterford, Connecticut, as an only child, Jesse's family relocated time and again. He attended three different elementary schools: Cohanzie, Quaker Hill and Oswegatchie Schools as well as Clark Lane Junior High School. An extraordinary visual artist in high school, his life-like pencil drawings and paintings were exhibited at the renowned Lyman...
data.text:
He is of one half Italian and one quarter Portuguese ancestry, with his other roots being English, Irish, and French-Canadian. His paternal grandmother and maternal grandfather were both of Italian origin, and his maternal grandmother was of Portuguese heritage. Jesse's paternal great-grandfather William Harry Metcalfe was born in Yorkshire, England, and moved to Massachusetts, where he married Jesse's great-grandmother Catherine Young.

He was in a relationship with actress Cara Santana from 2009 and they were engaged from August 2016 to January 2020.

Featured along with former Nash Bridges (1996) star, Jodi Lyn O'Keefe, in the "3 Doors Down" music video for "Let Me Go". (February 2005)

Decided not to renew his contract for Passions (1999). The show has made no decision whether or not his part will be recast. He has been playing the role of "Miguel Lopez-Fitzgerald" since Passions (1999) debuted in 1999. (March 2004)

Currently playing the part of U.S. Marshall Luke Watson on the TV Series, "Chase" alongside lead Kelli Giddish. (September 2010)
